New in and children's reading ideas

Beat the holiday boredom with our summer events and activities for children and families →

Reviews, suggestions and lists of new books for children aged 0-11. We have recommendations for readers aged 11+ in our Young Adult section.

New children's books for June 2019

Written by Sophie Green · Published May 30, 2019

New titles for fans of penguins, the Moon, classic stories and more.

Mark the 2019 Suffolk Show with our top farm-related titles for young children

Written by Sophie Green · Published May 28, 2019

The Suffolk Show 2019 takes place on 29 and 30 May. To mark the occasion we've picked out some of our favourite farming-themed children's books.

Pick up a great story for 6-8 year-olds from the inaugural Alligator's Mouth Award shortlist

Written by Sophie Green · Published May 8, 2019

The new Alligator's Mouth Award celebrates the best short chapter books of the year.

Oulton Broad Library choose: Diary of a Wimpy Kid, by Jeff Kinney

Written by Alice Violett · Published May 5, 2019

Every day throughout Children's Month (April 2019), we'll be revealing our libraries' favourite books. Today, Oulton Broad Library has chosen Diary of a Wimpy Kid, by Jeff Kinney.

Glemsford Library choose: The 13-Storey Treehouse, by Andy Griffiths & Terry Denton

Written by Alice Violett · Published May 4, 2019

Every day throughout Children's Month (April 2019), we'll be revealing our libraries' favourite books. Today, Glemsford Library has chosen The 13-Storey Treehouse, by Andy Griffiths & Terry Denton.

Debenham Library choose: Gangsta Granny, by David Walliams & Tony Ross

Written by Alice Violett · Published May 3, 2019

Every day throughout Children's Month (April 2019), we'll be revealing our libraries' favourite books. Today, Debenham Library has chosen Gangsta Granny, by David Walliams & Tony Ross.

Stradbroke Library choose: Rabbit's Nap, by Julia Donaldson & Axel Scheffler

Written by Alice Violett · Published May 2, 2019

Every day throughout Children's Month (April 2019), we'll be revealing our libraries' favourite books. Today, Stradbroke Library has chosen Rabbit's Nap, by Julia Donaldson & Axel Scheffler.

Southwold Library choose: Oi Frog!, by Kes Gray & Jim Field

Written by Alice Violett · Published May 1, 2019

Every day throughout Children's Month (April 2019), we'll be revealing our libraries' favourite books. Today, Southwold Library has chosen Oi Frog!, by Kes Gray & Jim Field.

Beccles Library choose: The Amber Spyglass, by Philip Pullman

Written by Alice Violett · Published Apr 30, 2019

Every day throughout Children's Month (April 2019), we'll be revealing our libraries' favourite books. Today, Beccles Library has chosen The Amber Spyglass, by Philip Pullman.

New children's books for May 2019

Written by Sophie Green · Published Apr 29, 2019

New titles from Sarah McIntyre, Phil Earle, Nicola Davies and more.
